oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter to Daniel Hoge Bruce from his cousin Sue
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter to Daniel Hoge Bruce, Co. A, 51st Va. Inf., Regt., CSA, from his cousin, Sue. She writes passionately about the destruction the South. Yet, she fears the outcome of surrender: "war, cruel and unrelenting as it is, would be far preferable to peace and subjugation...repeopled by a savage foe would be worse than the worst of wars. No peace could reign where so much precious blood has flown unaccompanied by Liberty."
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
